topic.title: How to Use Fonts for Symbols

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p: For some specific symbols (like arrows), you must use a font or a sequence of fonts that cover the needed character ranges. As an example, suppose the right arrow character is used in a definition list like this:<dlentry> <dt>→</dt> <dd><ph>This is the right arrow.</ph></dd> </dlentry>
If you are using Roboto, the character is not found, the # symbol is used and a warning is thrown (see also ):[CH] Glyph "?" (0x2192, arrowright) not available in font "Roboto-Bold".
The PDF output will then look like this: # This is the right arrow.
